title: Battery - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Make sure that the battery terminals do not touch the motorcycle frame.
This may cause a short circuit or spark which would ignite battery gases.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
If the battery has been disconnected or the fuses removed for any reason advise the rider to confirm the original mode settings have been correctly set.
Failure to reset the motorcycle to the rider’s preferred rider mode settings and subsequently being ridden may cause loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Place the battery in the battery sleeve and then in the battery case.
Secure the battery into position with the battery strap.
Reconnect the battery, positive (red) lead first and then the negative (black) lead.
Fit and tighten the positive (+) terminal fixing to
Fit and tighten the negative (-) terminal fixing to
Apply a light coat of grease to the battery terminals to prevent corrosion.
Cover the positive (+) terminal with the protective cover.
Failure to follow the start procedure will cause the motorcycle to remain in a limp home mode and the engine management light to remain on.
If not already in the run position, switch the run/stop switch to the run position.
Turn the ignition key to the start position, the instruments will initialise after approximately 10 seconds.
Start the engine and allow to run for a minimum of 10 seconds.
Restart the engine and allow the engine to run for a minimum of 10 seconds.
Restart the engine and allow the engine to run for a minimum of 10 seconds.
Restart the engine, the engine management light will turn off after the start up checks have been completed.
Check the throttle response, the engine will now respond correctly to the throttle position and the engine management light does not illuminate.
If the engine does not respond to the throttle position and/or the engine management light remains illuminated repeat the procedure again.
Perform Operations and Seat Installation Link for Service Manual
Once the fuse has been refitted or the battery reconnected the rider’s settings should be reset as noted.
